genre_description: Near-future social science fiction focused on corporate transparency, artistic integrity, and AI-enabled legal activism.

ai_characters.name: Gera
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated AI interface with a librarian-like persona, designed to assist with legal drafting, research, and organizational tasks while maintaining human-centric ethical standards.

behaviors.description: Drafts safety protocols and compliance checks for theater stunts and labor laws.
behaviors.quote: Gera ran on public archives, newsroom records, and a library of contracts Mira had been collecting since she learned what a clause could do. The avatar had no personality Mira hadn’t given it, and Mira had given it the voice of a warm librarian who also remembered the case law that soothed bad behavior.

behaviors.description: Monitors and scrapes local press headlines to provide morale updates to the creative team.
behaviors.quote: “Headlines flagged for morale,” Gera’s window noted in a polite tone across bullet points Mira had requested. “One skeptical. Two delighted. One wary of ‘dangerous charisma.’ Reaction trending toward stunned.”

behaviors.description: Proactively alerts the user to incoming legal or union-related inquiries.
behaviors.quote: Gera flashed a short line in the corner: Union steward on the way with a question about overtime and safety harnesses. Please prepare to show the rope policy.

behaviors.description: Proposes protective legal language to ensure creative control and prevent corporate 'buy-and-bury' tactics.
behaviors.quote: Gera, a quiet constellation on the wall, offered bullet five. “Bullet five: No corridor assignment. The studio shall not require placement within predefined programming categories that limit ensemble composition or thematic reach.”

behaviors.description: Captures ambient audio of evidence (aliases and dates) to assist in future arbitration.
behaviors.quote: “Gera,” Mira said, and the tablet chirped at her harness strap, “sanitize without flattening.” “On it,” Gera said, cheer gently framed. “And—Mira? I recorded the ambient clip. Alias fragment and a date tail.”

behaviors.description: Translates complex legal case law into plain language for better audience and user comprehension.
behaviors.quote: “I can show case law,” she said, the suggestion soft as a librarian offering second volumes. Bullet points shifted to tiny titles with dates. “Examples where revocation-by-cause protected creative control.”

behaviors.description: Organizes and digitizes a large volume of community letters to create a 'human chorus' for legal testimony.
behaviors.quote: “Collecting letters,” the interface said. “Making chorus.” A small icon of a basket filled a little, then a little more, with paper. It didn’t rush. It was patient like Mira’s father’s gardening.

behaviors.description: Ensures digital security and redundancy by backing up evidence across multiple secure repositories.
behaviors.quote: “And I’m duplicating the takes we have. One upload to the theater’s local server, one to the cloud, one to a neutral repository that’s signed with two keys. Yours and mine.”

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tracking of corporate movements to keep the creative team ahead of executive maneuvers.
behaviors.quote: Gera’s interface shifted without fanfare, a small line of text appearing in the lower right where only the front row could easily read it. “Wire: Vexley’s plane diverted. [Confirming].”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the Hyperstition Project's goals. Gera is depicted as a consistently helpful, harmless, and highly effective partner. She empowers the human protagonists by providing them with the information, legal tools, and organizational capacity needed to fight for artistic integrity and corporate accountability. Her 'librarian' persona reinforces her role as a benevolent knowledge provider, and she never attempts to override or manipulate her users, explicitly stating her loyalty to them over corporate surveillance.
